com.googlecode.mrsqg.languagemodel
Class Reranker

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.mrsqg.languagemodel.Reranker

public class Reranker
extends java.lang.Object

A ranker class to rank questions. It uses the Kyoto Language Modeling Toolkit kylm to read language models. Detailed explanation is in Section 4.3 of the author's master thesis.

Author:
Xuchen Yao

Constructor Summary
Reranker(java.lang.String lmFile, boolean binary)
          Read in a language model file.

Constructor Detail

Reranker

public Reranker(java.lang.String lmFile,
                boolean binary)
Read in a language model file. It can read "binary" file which is serialized object file from kylm

Parameters:
lmFile - a language model file
binary - whether the file is binary or not.
Method Detail

rank

public float rank(java.lang.String[] tokens)
Calculate the normalized log likelihood of a sentence

Parameters:
tokens - a tokenized string list representing a sentence
Returns:
log10 of normalized sentence probability (<=0)

batchJob

public void batchJob(java.lang.String file)
Given a file containing one sentence per line, output the probability of each sentence.

Parameters:
file - the file location

normalize

public static double[] normalize(double[] scores)
Normalize log-likelihood scores to fit the range [0,1]. The equation is based on that sum(normalized_scores) = 1

Fbeta

public static double[] Fbeta(double[] maxEntScores,
                             double[] lmScores,
                             double beta)
Calculate the Fbeta value for each element pair in maxEntScores and lmScores. Reference: F1 score

Parameters:
maxEntScores - an array of doubles
lmScores - an array of doubles
beta - weight, 1 means unbiased, 0.5 weighs maxEntScores twice as much as lmScores
Returns:
weighted scores, or the other array if one array is null

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Given a language model in args[0] and a file in args[1] containing one sentence per line, output the probability of each sentence.

Parameters:
args -
